item.title: A foundation in fractals
item.author: Felix Editor,Zofia Strzelecka,
item.description: Fractals are everywhere we look. Clouds, snowflakes, broccoli – even mountains are full of them. Simply put, a fractal is a never-ending pattern that can be defined as ‘a rough or fragmented geometric shape that can be subdivided in parts, each of which is a reduced-size copy of the whole’. This …

item.title: Imperial doesn’t need your money

item.description: A spectre is haunting Imperial: the spectre of tuition fees. Six years ago now, the conservative-led government tripled fees, expanding on a policy started by New Labour.
